content:
#91254 fixed several instances of confusing and misleading diagnostics, including this particularly bizarre one: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/241545-t-release/topic/backport.20for.20regression.20in.201.2E58

There's a point release coming up, but it's before the next T-compiler meeting, so @simulacrum said this:

simulacrum said:

I stable nominated, but current release date is sooner than next compiler team meeting. If someone could kickoff a thread on t-compiler and ping Aaron and Wesley + Felix as leads that's probably the right next step.
So: cc @Aaron Hill @Wesley Wiser @pnkfelix for backport decision

To clarify, this is the current state of the regression AFAIK:

  • 1.57.0 -> OK
  • 1.58.0 (stable) -> regression
  • 1.59.0 (beta) -> OK
  • 1.60.0 (nightly) -> OK
